abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Mauritius Sugar Energy Development
            Project (SEDP) in Mauritius. The overall outcome of the
            projects was rated as marginally satisfactory; the
            performance of the Bank and the borrower was also rated as
            marginally satisfactory. The broad objective of SEDP was to
            help Government of Mauritius (GOM) and the private sector
            implement the initial time slice of the Bagasse Energy
            Development Program (BEDP) (1992-95), which focused on
            establishing a firm power plant at the Union St Aubin Power
            Mill (UStA), operating on bagasse and coal, as part of the
            least-cost program for electric power development in
            Mauritius. The main lesson learned from the SEDP is that the
            development of bagasse-based electricity generation in
            Mauritius requires a stronger linkage between the
            developments in the sugar industry and those in the power
            sector, a greater emphasis on multi-purpose benefits of
            baseload bagasse/coal power plants, and new approaches on
            the part of both the Bank and Borrower in evaluating and
            supervising cross-sector projects.
